releases.details: Released in a box set with 'State of Decay' and 'Warriors' Gate' titled 'The E-Space Trilogy'
special_features: Commentary by Matthew Waterhouse, Andrew Smith, and Christopher H. Bidmead
All Aboard the Starliner - Cast and crew look back at the making of this story
Swap Shop - Noel Edmonds chats to Matthew Waterhouse

notes: The working title for this story was The Planet That Slept.
Adric's name was suggested as an anagram of physicist Paul Dirac.
Andrew Smith was a seventeen-year-old who achieved his lifelong ambition to write for the show.
Andrew Smith visited the location shoot but was unwell and vomited on the Marshmen costumes.
The notion of Alzarius' coordinates being the negative of Gallifrey's was introduced by John Nathan-Turner.

real_world_cultural_references: TARDIS being referred to as Noah's Ark
Adric's mathematical badge as an anagram of Paul Dirac
individuals: Adric with a Badge of Mathematical Excellence

continuity_notes: The Doctor is looking forward to reuniting with Leela, K9 Mark I and Andred on Gallifrey.
Romana is summoned to Gallifrey because she was supposed to help the Doctor only with the quest for the Key to Time.
The Doctor mentions having dropped off their 'Earth friend' whom they had picked up on Tigella.
The Primords in 'Inferno' share the Marshmen's trait of being weakened by gas.

plot.plot_summary: The TARDIS is transported through a Charged Vacuum Emboitement into E-Space, landing on Alzarius where the humanoid inhabitants live in fear of the Marshmen who emerge at Mistfall. With society maintaining an endless cycle of repairing a starliner to leave the planet, the Fourth Doctor discovers the shocking truth about their origins. Adric joins the crew as they attempt to escape the Marshmen's assault.
